Mark cannot believe what he is seeing. Suddenly, Karin's diaphragm expands as she sucks in air. Doc reaches around and pries her mouth open, releasing a sizable piece of hog dog and bun. As he turns her over, we can see the blueness disappearin from her face as she continues to breathe deeply. Doc peels back each eyelid in turn, stares at the pupil for a few seconds, and lets the eye close. DCC GRAHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's okay. I don't think the fall really hurt her, just the dog in her throat. She'll be coming around in a minute or two. RAY (SIGHS DEEPLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Doc. Doc looks deeply into Ray's eyes. DOC GRAHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, son. Thank you. It just now sinking for Ray what-Doc Graham has sacrifice to save the child. Ray looks to the field, and then back at the Doctor. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Oh, my God, you can't go back. DOC GRAHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay... (NODS KNOWINGLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark is slack-jawed. He has seen something magical happen and cannot explain it. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw...A11 of a sudden this kid runs off the field and turns.into... CONTINUED     108 152 CONTINUED 152

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks questioningly at Annie. She smiles reassuringly. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's hope for you yet, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc Graham stands, and picks up his black bag. DOC GRAHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I best be getting back home before Alicia starts to thinking I've got a girlfriend. He walks around the edge of the fence, and heads for the outfield door. The players respectfully make way for him. HAPPY FELSCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work, Doc. EDDIE CICOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Doc. DOC GRAHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, boys. Win one for me, someday, will you? He passes them. SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hev rookie! Doc Graham turns. SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were good. Only now do Doc Graham's eyes shine with tears. He smiles and disappears through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karin is coming to, Ray and Annie by her side. Some of th players start to gather up their equipment. Shoeless Joe calls to Ray. SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna call it a night. We'll see you tomorrow. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. CONTINUED     109 154 CONTINUED 154 MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. Joe starts to trot off the field, then he stops and turns back to the bleachers. SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You wanna come with us? Ray's jaw drops. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it? SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you. (points to Mann) Him. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him? MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with you? SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out there. MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is out there? SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come find out. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. Why him? Shoeless Joe and the other players wait for Mann to join them, ignoring Ray's question. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I built this field! You wouldn't be here if it weren't for me. MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, for God's sake, I'm unattached. You've got a family. This takes Ray down a peg or two. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want to know what's out there! I want to see it! CONTINUED     110 154 CONTINUED (2) MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reason they chose me, just as there was a reason they chose you to find me. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Why? MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, you big jerk, I gave that interview. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What interview? MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one about Ebbets Field. The one that charged you up and sent you all the way to Boston to find me. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you lied to me. MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were kidnapping me at the time, you asshole! Think of it, Ray: maybe there's an Ebbets Field still floating around out there somewhere. And maybe I'll get to sit in the stands, and watch a twenty-year-old kid with a smooth face and kinky hair try out for the 1948 Dodgers. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shoeless Joe) So I do all the work, and all I get is to see everybody else's dreams come true. Is that it? SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, Ray? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying I'm happy for you, and I'm happy for him, but after all this what's in it L for me? SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you did this? For-you? MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something out there for me, Ray. And what a story it'll make: a man being able to touch the perfect dream. CONTINUED     111 154 CONTINUED (3) 154 RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll write about it? MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet I will. Annie walks Karin over. Ray bends down to Karin's face. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feeling, honey? KARIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid. Ray laughs and hugs her. He looks up at Annie. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry's been invited to go-with the players. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean 'out'? RAY (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out. ANNIE (HUMS TWILIGHT ZONE THEME)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doo-doo-doo-doo. Be careful. She smiles brightly and gives Mann a kiss on the cheek. Mann shakes Ray's hand. RAY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a full description. MANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -You take care of this family, Ray. Mann joins several of the White Sox as they leave the field. 155 MARK 155

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is absolutely dumbfounded as'he sees the players fade out upon walking through the outfield gate. He turns to Annie MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just... Where'd he...? CONTINUED     112

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 155 ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go inside and lie down. I'll explain later. Mark walks off toward the people in their cars outside th MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd all these people come from...?

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE FIELD
dialogues.text: 2.56 Only a few players are left on the field. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're keeping this field. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your ass we are. Ray realizes Shoeless Joe is staring at him, with a shit-eating grin on his face. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.. Shoeless Joe just keeps smiling. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you grinning at, you ghost? SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'If you build it... He nods toward where the catcher is taking off his gear a SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ' .he will come.' Ray looks at the Catcher. The hairs on the back of his neck begin to stand up. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its my father.     113

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNG CATCHER
dialogues.text: has taken off his mask. He is in his early twenties. He is in the same pose as the photo we saw in the prologue.

dialogues.speaker: RAY AND SHOELESS JOE
dialogues.text: Ray blanches and turns to Shoeless Joe, his voice a strangled whisper. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it ain't so,- Joe. SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it is, kid. The Catcher is now walking toward Ray. RAY (FINALLY UNDERSTANDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ease his pain...' SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles and nods) 'Go the distance.' When he says those words, Shoeless Joe sounds just like T Voice. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you. 159 SHOELESS JOE 159 SHOELESS JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Ray. It was you. Shoeless joe winks and walks away, disappearing through t door in the outfield fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Catcher is halfway across the field. Ray turns to Annie. He cannot even swallow. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, I only saw him later, when he was worn down by life. Look at him. The young Catcher has reached the outfield grass. Ray walks down to the edge of the outfield. CONTINUED     114 160 CONTINUED 160 RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has his whole life in front of him, and I'm not even a glint in his eye. What do I say to him? ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Introduce him to his granddaughter. Ray cannot believe how wonderful Annie is. The Catcher ha reached the edge of the field, and now stands before Ray and Annie. CATCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I just wanted to thank you folks for putting up the field and letting us play here. I'm John Kinsella. They shake his hand. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ray. My wife Annie. And this is my daughter, Karin. (TO KARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karin, this is... He almost says "My father." RAY KARIN JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Annie are beaming. Annie takes Karin's hand. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to let you two talk. I have to go look after our guests. Someone's gotta start collecting admission if we're going to keep this place. (to the Catcher) Very nice meeting you. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M' am. 161 ANNIE 161

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hoists Karin up and totes her toward the tourists waiting in front of the house.     115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watch them for a while, then start to,stroll across the field. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You catch a good game. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It's so beautiful here. Its like-well for me, it's like a dream come true. Ray cannot speak. He nods. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something? Again, Ray nods. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this heaven? Ray smiles and shakes his head no. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Iowa. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iowa. I could've sworn this was heaven. 163 RAY 16 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stops and looks intently at John. He asks this question as if he were asking the secret of life. Maybe he is. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a heaven? 164 JOHN 164

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes time to answer that. He looks up at the night sky and searches it. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah... Then he looks square into Ray's eyes. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven's where dreams come true.     116 165 RAY 165

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks toward the house and sees his wife and daughter on the veranda, a moon bright as butter silvering the night above them. He smiles. He finally understands. He turns back to John and nods. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe this is heaven. 166 JOHN 166

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: smiles wisely in return. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...good night, Ray. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. 167 MASTER 167

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John starts to walk off toward the door in the outfield fence. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! John turns back. Ray is holding a ball. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna have a catch? John closes his eyes for a second, and when he opens them there is the hint of moisture. Does he know Ray is his son? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that. Ray tosses him the ball, picks up a glove lying there, an puts it on. They throw the ball back and forth. And as we pull up higher and higher we see a father and s bathed by white floodlights and car headlights... on the silent, satiny green of a baseball diamond at the edge of a cornfield. FADE OUT THE END
